title: Calories in a Chili
meta_description: Learn calories in a chili serving, plus full nutrition breakdown including protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard beef chili con carne with ground beef, kidney beans, tomatoes, onions, and spices; 1 cup (245 g) serving, homemade without added cheese or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and preparation method. Check labels for canned or restaurant versions.

quick_answer.text: One cup of beef chili provides about 286 kcal and 17 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Turkey chili (ground turkey instead of beef)

faqs.q: How many calories in a bowl of chili?
faqs.a: About 286 kcal for a 1-cup serving of beef chili.
Yes, one serving has around 17 g protein from beef and beans.

faqs.q: What's the carb count in a chili?
faqs.a: Approximately 23 g carbs, including 6 g fiber, per cup.

faqs.q: How does canned chili compare in calories?
faqs.a: Canned versions often have 200-300 kcal per cup but higher sodium; check the label.
Yes, use lean turkey, more veggies, and less oil to drop calories below 200 per serving.
